page.title: 02EDUCATION IN BLOFIELD
page.content: The school in Blofield was constructed in 1877.The previous headmaster,Mr Eric Bacon,built the schools own swimming pool 23 years ago with the help of a few parents.The school also has many other facilities, netball court,football pitch,cricket pitch,playground,recreational apparatus and high jump and long jump pits.The school field of about one acre was drastically reduced in size due to the building of the new Blofield by-pass built in 1981.Many new facilities have been built in the past few years.These are two new anexes and indoor toilets.Blofield County Primary school has 132 children with ages ranging from four to eleven.There are five classes,two infant classes and three juniors.The new headmaster,Mr Chris Clements has been working there since 1981.
